newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT -FTSE may sink to 4,890 then hold steady.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT -FTSE may sink to 4,890 then hold steady.

text.p: The FTSE 100 index may sink back to 4,890 on Friday and then try to hold steady for most of the session, technical analysts said.
Confrontation to levels above 4,940 will have to wait awhile following Thursday's aimless wandering and a late sell-off which will have unnerved investors, they added.
By 0710 GMT, the FTSE was indicated up 1.2 to 4,908.7.
Technically, the market fell back yesterday before meeting the top of an upward channel which consists of a pair of parallel trendlines connecting the FTSE's intra-day highs and lows since July 28.

Vertical distance between the parallel lines is about 60 points and the lower end of the channel is now near 4,900. Although the FTSE stayed within its channel boundaries on Thursday, analysts expressed doubts that it could cling to that level -- at least for the first half of today's session.
The FTSE closed at around its two-thirds retracement level following the loss of 200 points on an intra-day basis between July 18-19 and as a result it may now ease back.
Any ambitions to scale new heights will be thwarted if economic data from the U.S. at 1230 GMT shows non-farm payrolls and wage inflation are higher than expected.
Economists polled by Reuters forecast U.S. non-farm payrolls for July to have increased by 193,000 taking the unemployment rate to 4.9 percent.
Average hourly earnings for July are expected to have risen by 0.2 percent.

The stock market should get a boost if the actual figures are at least in-line with forecasts, but the FTSE may tumble if payroll numbers are greater than expected and these are accompanied by a jump in hourly earnings, analysts said.
